text: Al-Urwa (, The Bond) was an Arabic magazine published in Iraq in the 1950s and financed by the US government during the cultural Cold War. The magazine intended to call on Arabs and Muslims to unite against communism, emphasizing the goodness of America and the Western world. ==See also== * Al Hiwar ==References== Category:Anti-communist propaganda Category:Anti-communism in Iraq Category:Arabic-language magazines Category:Defunct magazines published in Iraq Category:Magazines published in Iraq Category:Defunct literary magazines Category:United States government propaganda organizations Category:United States propaganda in Iraq Category:Magazines with year of disestablishment missing Category:Magazines with year of establishment missing
title: Al-Urwa (Iraqi magazine)
